qas.question: The state's economy was largely defined by these two industries.
Diaz promoted economic growth by encouraging investment from foreign companies at the expense of what group?
What was the name of the large estates owned by wealthy families?
This group was often exploited and had no legal protection or recourse.

context: A handful of families owned large estates (known as <a2_0>haciendas<a2_0/>) and controlled the greater part of the land across the state while the vast majority of Chihuahuans were landless. The state economy was largely defined by <a0_0>ranching and mining<a0_0/>. At the expense of the <a1_0>working class<a1_0/>, the Díaz administration promoted economic growth by encouraging investment from foreign companies from the United Kingdom, France, Imperial Germany and the United States. The <a3_0>proletariat<a3_0/> was often exploited, and found no legal protection or political recourse to redress injustices.
